page.title: 20 HISTORICAL PLACE NAMES
page.content: {St. Helen's Well} Nobody knows anything about St.Helen herself but it is believed that the well was visited by pilgrims in medieval times because the drinking of the water sometimes brought about miraculous cures. In the 18th Century the farmer, who rented the field containing the well, became so angry at the damage done to his crops by visitors that he smashed the surrounding wall. Now only the red stones and the spring can be seen. {Castle Dikes}This is the site of a Roman town.About 40 years ago it was excavated and two different types of under floor central heating were found. It is a valuable historic site and when the road was improved about 12 years ago a large bend was necessary to avoid Castle Dikes.Local archeologists hope to dig there again.
